episodes.description: Pete Martel, a mitigation specialist at the State Appellate Defender's Office and former 14-year inmate talks about how having family support and attending community college set him on a path to becoming a lawyer.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Rob Engel
episodes.description: Rob Engel, a former offender who battled drug addiction is now a Outreach Specialist at the Lansing Financial Empowerment Center. Rob helps parolees and probationers reduce their debts and improve their financial health. He shares his success with our Field Days host in this week's episode.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Vivitrol Pilot Program
episodes.description: The Vivitrol Pilot Program is the first step to broadening medication-assisted treatment for alcohol and opioid substance abusers. Vivitrol is an injection that is administered to offenders on a voluntary basis to block the feelings of getting drunk or high. Noah returns as co-host with Chris to interview Sherri Sankey, the health unit manager and Keith Jones, a mental health social worker from the Detroit Reentry Center. Julia Hitchingham, the substance abuse services manager also provides an overview of why the department is utilizing Vivitrol.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Truck Driving Program
episodes.description: Ryan Powell and Angie Sprank from the reentry join Chris and Greg to talk about the truck driving training program for offenders looking to start a rewarding career after prison. You can also read more about the truck driving program in the Corrections Connection: http://www.michigan.gov/documents/corrections/CC_FebruaryNewsletter2017_552842_7.pdf

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - WRAP Program
episodes.description: Returning co-host Noah Nagy joins Chris Gautz this week to talk about the Wayne County Residential Alternative to Prison (WRAP) program at Detroit Reentry Center with agent Verlynda Winston. She provides an overview of the intensive second chance program that provides G.E.D. classes and skilled trade opportunites for probation violators.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - MDOC Budget Update
episodes.description: Happy Valentine's Day, listeners! Field Days, talks to Kyle Kaminski, the department's legislative liaison about the current budget proposal. He provides an overview of the budget process and what's included in the budget for the upcoming fiscal year.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Lieutenant Charles Levens
episodes.description: In this episode of Field Days, Lieutenant Levens from the Absconder Recovery Unit (ARU), talks to Greg and Chris about the hardships, the successes and what it takes to be a member of the ARU team.

episodes.title: SPECIAL EDITION Field Days Podcast - Director Washington
episodes.description: The first ever special edition podcast features an interview with Director Washington and her thoughts on why staff should take the Employee Engagement Survey. In this episode, you'll hear about the innovative ways the department has improved since the last survey in 2015.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Employee Survey
episodes.description: In the latest episode of Field Days, Greg Straub and Chris Gautz chat with Kathy Kieffer from the EPIC section and Lieutenant Matt Mates from Parnall Correctional Facility to talk about the upcoming Employee Engagement Survey. You can expect to get answers from some of the most frequently asked questions about the survey in this episode. The survey will kick-off on February 6 and end February 28. The department's participation goal is 75 percent.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Linsey LaMontagne Community Corrections
episodes.description: Linsey LaMontagne is the manager for the Office of Community Corrections and she talks about how the office utilizes programming to aid in offender success.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Kathy Arnold
episodes.description: In the latest episode of Field Days, Greg Straub and Chris Gautz chat with Kathy Arnold, probation sentencing specialist, to talk about the Probation Sentencing Specialist Pilot. You'll learn in greater detail the reason for the pilot and the results that have been reached in the months since the pilot began.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Deputy Director Marlan and McKee
episodes.description: Greg and Chris sit down with Deputy Directors Russ Marlan and Ken McKee to talk about their future plans for the year and what their administrations accomplished in 2016.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - 2016 Year In Review
episodes.description: In the latest episode of Field Days, Greg Straub and Chris Gautz recount the many positive changes that took place this year. Greg talks about changes made in the Field Operations Administration and Chris shares positive news coverage the MDOC received this year.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Monica Drake
episodes.description: In this new episode of Field Days, Greg Straub and Chris Gautz chat with Monica Drake, a communications representative for the Office of Performance and Transformation, to talk about the employee engagement survey taking place in February. You’ll learn all about the anonymity of the survey and changes that were made as a result of the last survey.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Chef Jimmy Hill
episodes.description: In the latest episode of Field Days, Greg Straub and Chris Gautz chat with Chef Jimmy Hill, the Lakeland Correctional Facility Food Tech instructor who talks about how he's used his culinary skills to train prisoners so they may receive jobs once released. Learn more about the program and Chef Hill in this story from Hour Detroit Magazine: http://www.hourdetroit.com/Hour-Detroit/December-2016/Raw-Talent/

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Vocational Village
episodes.description: In the latest episode of Field Days, Greg Straub and Chris Gautz chat with DeWayne Burton, warden of the Richard A. Handlon Correctional Facility to talk about the Vocational Village. You’ll learn all about this innovative program that is the first-of-its-kind in the country and all the work the staff does there to find jobs for the prisoners upon parole.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Harvest Gathering
episodes.description: Greg and Chris chat with Andie Saunto, an executive secretary for the training division, about the results of the Harvest Gathering fundraiser campaign. There's also a special shout out to our Absconder Recovery Unit for their domestic violence prevention efforts last month.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast- Former Idaho DOC Director Kevin Kempf
episodes.description: Greg and Chris sit down this week with the Former Idaho Dept. of Corrections Director, Kevin Kempf. In this light and fun interview, Chris and Greg talk about Director Kempf’s use of social media in a very creative and transparent way. Kevin talks about how he is changing the culture of corrections in Idaho and the importance of getting out of the office to talk with staff and promote the great work they do on a daily basis.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Lame Duck session
episodes.description: Greg and Chris sit down with the department's legislative liaison, Kyle Kaminski to discuss the upcoming lame duck session and what legislation will be proposed that affects corrections.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Election Day
episodes.description: In this short episode of  Field Days, Greg and Chris talk about the recent results of the parole eligibility consideration process audit and fine dining in prison. Field Days' host also want you to remember to get out and make your vote count!

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Director Heidi Washington (part 2 of 2)
episodes.description: In part two of the one-year anniversary episode of Field Days, Chris Gautz (department spokesman) and Greg kick off the new weekly series of department-wide podcasts with Director Washington. The Director talks about the budget, department achievements and where she plans to lead next.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Director Washington (part 1 of 2)
episodes.description: It's Field Days one-year anniversary and it get's better! Noah and Greg interview the head of the Michigan Department of Corrections, Director Heidi Washington. She talks about leadership, social media, photo ops and more. Listen through the end for a special announcement.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast- Dr. David Chinsky (part 2 of 2)
episodes.description: In part 2 of the leadership series with Dr. David Chinsky you'll learn about the generational differences in the workforce today and how to change your leadership style to communicate effectively.

episodes.title: Field Days - Dr. David Chinsky (part 1 of 2)
episodes.description: Founder and CEO of The Institue for Leadership Fitness, Dr. David Chinsky discusses servant leadership and employee engagement.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Tim Selgo
episodes.description: Greg and Noah are back on-air with the first guest, Tim Selgo former athletic director of Grand Valley State University, of their series focused on leadership. Learn more on what it takes to be a great leader within the department.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Employee Banquet Recap
episodes.description: Noah and Greg recap the employee appreciation banquet and interview two special winners from the Field Operations Administration (FOA) staff.

episodes.title: Heroin Series - Christin Lett and Megan Phillips (part 4)
episodes.description: Greg and Noah interview guests for the Heroin Series: Becoming Champions for Change series from Community Programs, Inc. (CPI).

episodes.title: Heroin Series - Prosecutor Bill Nichols (part 3)
episodes.description: Prosecutor Bill Nichols from Monroe County Michigan joins Noah Greg on the third part of the "Heroin Series: Becoming Champions for Change."

episodes.title: Heroin Series - Judge Susan Beebe (part 2)
episodes.description: In part two of the "Becoming Champions for Change" heroin series of Field Days, you'll hear from 4th circuit court Judge Susan Beebe and she shares her experience with helping to treat heroin addicts.

episodes.title: Heroin Series - Chief Deputy Elmer Hitt and Lt. Christopher Simpson (part 1)
episodes.description: Heroin is a drug that negatively effects millions across the nation and Michigan is no different. In the first part of a five part series Greg and Noah interview law enforcement from the Jackson City Police Department to talk about what we as a team can do to combat the drug and crime problem caused by heroin addiction.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Deena Grammatico and Lori Leduc
episodes.description:
Greg and Noah head to Macomb County to interview FOA Probation Supervisors, Deena Grammatico (Robarge) and Lori Leduc. On this episode of Field Days you'll enjoy an array of topics ranging from selfies to team building.

Music courtesy of bensound.com

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Jerome Warfield
episodes.description: Interview with Parole Board member Jerome Warfield and he talks about his work with the board and with the Brightmoor community in Detroit.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Vonnie Hiller and Lara Neuman
episodes.description: Vonnie and Lara are agents in Kalamazoo that are a part of the pilot team for COMPAS, which acts as an additional tool for probation agents to offer recommendations to the court on a parolable offender.

episodes.title: Thanksgiving Field Days: Royce McKinney and Kaunda Gray
episodes.description: Greg and Noah interview former Buffalo Bills NFL player and now a parole and probation supervisor, Royce McKinney and Kaunda Gray a parole and probation program manager. The four of them discuss community work, Wayne county parole and probation programs and more.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Aaron Dungy and Lisa Hendricks
episodes.description: Your hosts Noah and Greg interview two parole agents from the Jackson county Parole office that talk about work life balance, specialty courts and Special Olympics.

episodes.title: Field Days Podcast - Erin DeLoof
episodes.description: Field Days Podcast - Erin DeLoof by Field Days
